Plenty of game apps claim you can earn extra money with minimal effort. They invite you to download the app, enter matches, and easily win large tournament jackpots. It seems too good to be true. Do any of these cash apps actually pay?

Solitaire Smash is one game that does. It won‚Äôt pay hundreds or thousands of dollars like many ads for other games promise (those are fake, by the way), but it does pay real cash. There are some tournaments with top prize brackets awarding $100 or more. Taking home a large prize isn‚Äôt easy though; it requires outstanding Solitaire skills, speed, and a little bit of luck.

Smaller pots, starting at around $4, are easier to take down. And there are free games, too.

This review will cover how the app works, how much you can make, and everything we like and don‚Äôt like about Solitaire Smash and similar game apps.

What is Solitaire Smash?

Solitaire Smash is a highly-ranked mobile game app that puts a contemporary twist on the classic Solitaire card game.

Play free practice games or participate in cash tournaments against players around the world. Wager and win virtual currency, gems, which can be redeemed for real money. Players can fund their accounts with extra money to purchase more virtual currency.

Is Solitaire Smash Legit?

Yes, Solitaire Smash is a legitimate game. Some reviews say that Solitaire Smash‚Äôs legitimacy is in question because you can lose money playing the game and the developer, PlayPerfect, only has one app in the iOS store.

However, you can lose money playing any tournament-style game ‚Äî even games by well-known developers with dozens of apps in the iOS store and ratings much overall lower than Solitaire Smash.

PlayPerfect‚Äôs website does have limited information, however, it is a newer company that has grown from 3 employees to 30 within a year. According to the company‚Äôs LinkedIn profile, PlayPerfect was founded in 2021 and is headquartered out of Tel Aviv, Israel.

You can read the terms and conditions for the app, which outline all guidelines in great detail, and find support contact information.

The Solitaire Smash game is currently ranked number 9 for all casino-style games in the Apple Store and has an average 4.8-star rating.

How to Earn Money with Solitaire Smash

To earn money with Solitaire Smash, you‚Äôll need to wager real money or virtual currency (gems) at Solitaire. This app version is similar to the classic card game where you clear stacks by making sequences in alternating colors.

Download the free Solitaire Smash app on Apple. Make sure you select the correct Solitaire game app with ‚ÄúPlay Perfect‚Äù listed as the developer.

After you install the app, you‚Äôll be prompted to create a player profile or you can go with the randomly generated name and avatar.

Play the onboarding tutorial.

A range of games are available at any time, including free games and high cash prize pools with payouts of $100 or more. There are also tournaments with a hybrid entry of both gems and a small cash amount.

Players start around with 100 gems. Earn more gems as you win free games, level up through winning games (tournament or free), or claim daily bonuses.

After I saved up 1,000 gems, I entered the Freebie Frenzy match. For an entry fee of 1,000 gems, you can play in a $7 cash prize pool. I took first place and earned $4. You can see all of your wins and losses in your results tab. As you can see, there are many rounds where I did not finish in first place.

Most tournaments are multi-bracket games where the top three (3) finishers receive a reward. There are also some one-on-one matches too.

Except for Freebie Frenzy, all cash tournaments require a cash entry fee. It is possible to earn enough gems to pay the entry fee for Freebie Frenzy, however, it will take a while to bank enough. You can win gems by playing free practice games and collecting daily bonuses for logging in.

It took me less than a day to earn 1,000 gems and enter a cash tournament for free and I did win the top $4 prize.

I played quite a bit on and off over a day. All told, it probably took about three (3) hours total to win enough gems. As I progressed from one level to the next, it became harder to win gems. It was easy to win the first 800 and hard to clear the final 200.

I could have just paid a few dollars to enter some cash games right away, but I wanted the free practice and I also wanted to see whether or not it was possible to earn enough gems to enter free cash games. And it is!

With my $4 prize, I could cash out or enter a couple of small prize pool tournaments, but I think that I am just going to keep playing more free games. I want to bank enough virtual gems to enter more free cash games.

Some people do play Solitaire Smash just for fun and never enter any cash tournaments. But if you do want to try and win some extra cash, this is the general flow.

  1. Install the free app on your iOS phone or iPad.
  2. Play the free tutorial game.
  3. Play free practice games to get used to the gaming experience and timer.
  4. Enter solitaire tournaments.

How Cash Tournaments Work

With cash tournaments, you are matched against players of a similar skill level. Everyone has the same time limit (usually 3 minutes or 5 minutes depending on the difficulty level) and the same set of cards and game layout, which is what makes the game skill-based.

Available prize pools change, based on special promotions. For most new players, you will be able to enter cash tournaments to win anywhere from $4 to $120 and the brackets will have anywhere from 5 to 9 players.

The entry fee for cash prize games can range from all gems (minimum 1,000) to up to $20. For the $120 tournament, 9 players wager $29 each. The top three finishers will win $60, $40, or $20. The house, or game app, keeps $60.

Before you enter a free or cash tournament, you see a preview of the prize earnings and how many winners there are.

When you cash out your winnings, they‚Äôll be paid via your bank account, Apple Pay, or PayPal.

  • Per tournament ‚Äì $100+ per tournament

Per month, you could reasonably earn $30 to $120. That‚Äôs if you average an extra $1 to $4 daily. This means you would need to win more tournaments than you lose. In most tournaments, you have a 50% chance of winning a cash prize (breaking even or better), or a 33% chance of winning prize money on top of your wager.

Some days you might net $10. Other days you might lose a few dollars. But if you are patient and consistent, and have decent Solitaire Smash skills, it could balance out.

By tournament, the high prize amount varies based on which games are available. Typically, it‚Äôs at least $100. At the date of this article‚Äôs publication, the highest reward is a $175 prize pool. There is a $25 entry fee, and the top finisher gets $70 or clears $45.

You can cash out your initial deposit and any winnings, but you cannot cash out any bonus cash. For example, if you paid $100 to get $120 worth of gems, you can cash out that initial $100 but the additional $20. That $20 is bonus money for you to play cash games.

If you win a tournament that you entered using bonus cash for the entry fee, any prize won can be cashed out.
